definition: (lit.) to fix one's gaze on/(fig.) to show interest in/(favorable) attention/favor
abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province
green/blue/black/youth/young (of people)
to glance/to look askance at

sentences.english: This eclipse will work to your favor.
sentences.chinese: 这次月偏食将您的青睐。

sentences.english: What is the number of real estate tycoons Zhujiaokuai favor of a plus?
sentences.chinese: 到底是什么让众多的地产巨子对住交会青睐有加呢？

sentences.english: It is greatly welcomed with a mass of enterprises and has built up a good company credit standing within and outside food industry.
sentences.chinese: 深受广大企业的青睐，在业内外享有良好的企业信誉。

sentences.english: Analysts seem to like the new pricing model.
sentences.chinese: 分析师们似乎很青睐新的定价模式。

sentences.english: I company produces the hubei type finely machine also quite broad new old customer's favour.
sentences.chinese: 我公司所生产鄂式细碎机也颇广大新老用户的青睐。

sentences.english: Rather, they strongly preferred the infected ones.
sentences.chinese: 相反，它们对感染植株青睐有加。

sentences.english: It's for these reasons that the MP5 is the favorite among counter-terrorists and police forces worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 因此MP5受到世界范围内的反恐和警力部队的青睐。

sentences.english: It gets a really nice reception at a very good publisher.
sentences.chinese: 受到颇有名气的出版商的青睐。

sentences.english: His eloquent speech has won him the favor of the .
sentences.chinese: 他的好口才为他赢得了选民的青睐。

sentences.english: Microsatellites are now favoured by developing countries, with the notable exception of India.
sentences.chinese: 微卫星如今受到除印度之外的发展中国家的青睐。

sentences.english: We have a wealth of imagination and association, and we hope to get the employer's favor.
sentences.chinese: 我们有丰富的想象力和联想力，希望得到雇主的青睐。

sentences.english: But some say the charts are slanted in favor of the stars who make the most small-screen appearances.
sentences.chinese: 而有人说排行榜十分青睐那些电视露面率很高的歌星。

sentences.english: "Jin Pin the spring" the brand, has won the general consumer's favor.
sentences.chinese: “金品春”品牌，赢得了广大消费者的青睐。

sentences.english: The Toyota Prius is the best-selling model.
sentences.chinese: 丰田的普锐斯是其中最受青睐的车型。

sentences.english: It is typically favored by large industrial SCR operators.
sentences.chinese: 这是典型的青睐大型工业可控硅运营商。

sentences.english: Eyelid surgery was second most popular at 29 percent. A face shaped like a goose egg and double eyelids were favorite, it showed.
sentences.chinese: 鹅蛋脸和双眼皮最受青睐。

definition: to chase after (a popular person or item)/to pursue/popularity
a craze/a popular wave/a hit with the public
to like/to love/to be fond of/favorite
to be partial towards sth/to favor/to prefer/preference/favorite
to approve/approval/acknowledgment/OK
to receive in no small measure
to fully experience (good or bad)
to treasure/to be very fond of
pet/favorite/darling
to rush like ducks (idiom); the mob scrabbles madly for sth unobtainable/an unruly crowd on a wild goose chase
to esteem/to think highly of/to accord importance to/to revere
current favorite/the latest thing/darling (of the market or the media etc)
to show appreciation for sb/to look upon sb with favor
numerous
to regard as important/to care about
favorable criticism/positive evaluation
